page.title: 19Landscape-Leeswood
page.content: The landscape of this area is rolling and hilly. The highest point is 850 feet, near the top of Hope Mountain.The lowest point 375 feet is the valley of Nant Brook as it leaves the area.The highest and lowest points are only a mile apart as the crow flies. The landscape is crossed by a number of small streams,the largest being the Terrig,Cegidog and the Nant Brook of Leeswood,Coed Talon and Pontybodkin. The villages are clustered around the sites of now-disappeared collieries. The villages have grown considerably in recent times;many outsiders have moved into the area because housing is relatively cheap.
